REVIEW_BODY:
Afternoon outing with 8 year old.
Sengkang pool is closed on Monday so did detour to WWW at the far end of the island 23 minutes drive from central.
Massive complex. Shopping. Eating. Full mini township services. And then a massive waterpark.

A bit expensive. But after local promotions quite OK. Great value for your boys. I deserve a senior discount 55+ because really I am to old for rides.

Torpedo was awesome! So scary for most 8+ year olds. Locked in a vertical coffin. Just like Arnie swartzshnegger in the movie!

Boy happy. Great dad son outing.
My children enjoyed waterplay fun at the park the whole day. Food and shopping too as there are bowling alley, Tayo indoor playground, NTUC and integrated resort.

REVIEW_TITLE: Family Time in Wild Wild Wet
REVIEW_BODY: Overall a slightly above time at Wild Wild Wet. I will start with the good points. Although this water theme park is 15 years old, and definitely requires a refresh, its clean and well maintained. There's food kiosk around the rides but its priced at a premium. The toilet and changing room are spacious, airy and well maintained. There's even a swim wear drying machine, which you have pay $1. What is nice is there are ridea for kids of all ages, including pre-school. I think there about 8 or 9 rides for young kids and teens, but i could be wrong. Opening hours are from 12 to 6pm normal days but the hours are from 10am to 8pm during school holidays. In short, for $22 per adult and $18 for kids, we spent only 4 hours before we decided to call it a day. As for parking, its cheaper parking outside at public carpark if you are spending half a day. Fun and my kids enjoyed themselves.

Midweek, off season this was very quiet which meant short waits, tons of floats and cheap cabana deals. Monsoon rain is not a problem when you're in swimsuits and already wet :) a great way to spend a rainy day!

Lots of different slides to suit all thrill levels, plus a lazy river and wave pool if you just want to chill out. A fun day! Get a cabana - nice shade and fans if it's hot or they have curtains to keep out the rain if it rains!. Plus a safe, towels and water. For 5 of us the cabana special deal worked out only slightly more than if we'd hired towels separately and got water etc.

It's hard to explain but it's basically located at the back of a mall (this was very weird for us kiwis) so afterwards we got food and shopped before waiting for our taxi back to the hotel.

We've been to Wet and Wild Gold Coast and this park is much smaller with less 'big scare'rides but still enough to keep us occupied for a good part of a day (even in heavy rain).

REVIEW_TITLE: Full on fun esp with kids.
REVIEW_BODY: School holiday is really children day everyday. So busy . Wonderful place to bring kids to play. It was really amazing !
Wild wild wet is nice for everyone. They have kids zone and adults. Lazy river is the best. My kids enjoyed so much until hard to leave the place. The place is huge and had many things to play.

REVIEW_TITLE: No clear instructions on how to redeem e ticket
REVIEW_BODY:
Check with the gate staff on how to use the e ticket in my phone, then they ask me to go to the ticket counter. After waiting for long time to reach the counter, the counter staff ask me to go to the information room. Then in the room the staff asks me to print the ticket out. So in the end the staff print the e ticket and I have to go to the counter and join the long queue again to redeem the ticket.

The staff is not knowledgeable on the redemption of the e ticket. And not helpful.

REVIEW_TITLE: A nice place to cool down with family and friends
REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the good water play grounds in Singapore. There are a number of slides which kids and adults can enjoy. Good place to wind down if you were with kids

As a family of 4 we had a fantastic time at WWW. Before we got to Singapore our plan was to go to Adventure Cove on Sentosa; but then some of our local friends told us about WWW. We made the right choice! Great rides, many are for couples or groups of 4 so we really enjoyed them as a family. They do have strict rules about no GoPro, watches, jewelry; even my wedding ring.

There is an efficient locker system with showers, etc. Clean and very usable. Great food options near by; we ate at the Thai restaurant as the duck restaurant was closed. Very reasonably priced and a great way to beat the Singapore heat.

at first tried to avoid the crowd and long queuing time then choose this waterpark a bit far from the city, this doesn't not disappoint my kid. lots of variety of slides, no more than 5 mins queue on every slide. right next to a shopping mall with plenty of food selections. highly recommend

The entrance price is a little steep but there are plenty of rides to suit all, and the day we went there were no queues so we all managed to have lots of rides. The only downside is that you are not allowed to bring your own food and drink in, they actually search your bags, and of course the food available in the park is pretty limited and costly, so fill up before you head in.

We had a great day at Wild Wild Wet. Took the MRT from downtown to Pasir Ris (E/W (green) line to the end) then walked to the park (5-10mins). Plenty of choice in terms of slides and attractions. Shaded areas with beds provided. Can walk on bare feet (can be a bit hot) but the surface is not too rough on bare feet.

Can easily spend 4-6 hours here.

Lockers are provided but have to pay for renting them :-(

Good changing rooms are available, nice and clean! With showers.

We visited with 2 kids (age 10-12) who had a great time.

It is a fair bit cheaper than Adventure Cove park on sentose which we also visited. Cant say its less good. It is more open and different from adventure cove, but a great attraction on its own.

We went to wild wild wet having seen the positive reviews on the trip advisor. We were looking for water park where our kids will have as many slides and water plays to choose from after our experience in dubai at wild wadi. We weren't disappointed. They have enjoyed every bit of it.

We went to this water park as well as Adventure Cove on Sentosa Island. This one was far better for "thrill ride" slides. It was much less busy than AC on a weekday, as AC required 20-40min waits even on a Friday. Apart from the bigger slides, there were tamer ones for the younger set. Our 8 and 11 year old girls had a great time, though were under the weight limit for the "Royal Flush" ride which the wife and I enjoyed a couple of times without the kids - it's quick, but very enjoyable! Adventure Cove on Sentosa has a rope/jump area that is worth copying at WWW if they have the inclination.

We visited on route back to Australia while staying at Changi airport( 15 mins away)
We enjoyed lunch At the attached shopping complex before entering . It wasn’t super cheap to enter a family pass plus a extra child was a good $100 Singapore so make sure you get a good few hours to get your value . Fabulous fun
Highly recommend.

REVIEW_TITLE: A fun day out with the kids!
REVIEW_BODY: We are a family of 5 (including 3 kids aged 13, 10 and 8). WWW is the lesser well known of the waterparks in Singapore (the other being Adventure Cove on Sentosa) and is certainly a lot cheaper (we paid for a Family Ticket & an extra child and it cost $124). The downside is that it is much further out of the city (in fact its out near Changi in Pasir Ris). We went on a Sunday - got there when it opened at 10am and it was fairly empty. Only from 2pm onwards did it start to get busy, that said, we didn't have to wait more than 10 mins for any slide! There are plenty of water slides to go on - yes some have height restrictions, but the park caters for all ages, from toddlers up to the trill seeking adult! There are plenty of benches and deck chairs - we paid for a cabana and although an extra $92, I would certainly recommend it! The food in the park itself is very expensive - however you are allowed out to buy food from the food court at the adjacent mall (and bring back into the park), although the choice is limited to a Food Hall (serving Chinese style rice and noddle dishes), a McDonalds and a Pizza Hut! There are plenty of lockers and changing room/ shower facilities plus a shop that sells swimming stuff and sun cream. We were there for over 6 hours and as a family we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The kids were worn out by the end, it was great fun and we'll certainly do it again. If you are unsure which waterpark to choose, this is the one!

This water park isn't that well known among tourists but in my opinion is better than Adventure Cove Park specially if you have young children. We went on a weekday it was very quite and we got a very good deal almost 40% less than Adventure Cove. The water park is connected to a mall and is 15min walking distance from Pasir Ris MRT. Very good lockers and changing facilities plus the showers are very nice to specially the kids one. The park has many big slides for thrill seekers a wave pool a Jacuzzi and many play areas for kids which were a huge hit with the little one. The reason we preferred this water park more is because of it open concept its very easy to keep eyes on your kids. We had a great time my 8 years old loved it.

REVIEW_TITLE: All the fun without the price tag ....
REVIEW_BODY:
This one is a long way from downtown Singapore and less accessible than the one on Sentosa. It has everything the other one has and more, but at a fraction of the price.

Wild Wild Wet is attached to a mall with tons of eateries, and provides a good shaded area for the family members who prefer to stay indoors.

The faint-hearted can enjoy almost all the rides the other one has; and for the adventurous, there are mega slides that are way above the level provided there.

Bring your own slippers, shampoo and towel. Oh, yes, save your money and eat in the mall.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great fun for kids and adults alike
REVIEW_BODY:
Really good water amusement park with a variety of slides and water attractions. My son's favorites were the kraken racers, the huge whitewater tubes and the water-slide that is completely dark inside. My favourite was the Shiok river which is basically just an excuse to lie back on an inner tube and relax in tropical singapore for a while.
The setup here is really practical, clean and organised. There are lockers for your clothes, big change-room/shower areas, a shop at the front selling any swimming gear you may have forgotten and the staff will give you a pass out so you can go and get lunch from the attached shopping centre.
It is at Pasir Ris which is a bit off the tourist trail but that just makes it less crowded which suited us fine

REVIEW_TITLE: Good to spend time in weekends with children
REVIEW_BODY: Clean pool, not so crowded. At least 2.5 to 3 hours spend time in this area. Eat meals outside near wild wild wet and go in better as not much to eat inside. Mostly they only sale drinks, ice cream ect.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great for kids of all ages
REVIEW_BODY: Went on a Saturday with 3 adults and 4 kids. Wasn't too busy and we easily found a seat. Younger kids were able to splash around in wave pool, float down river or have water fights. Plenty for them too do. We were also able to get a pass out so could go next door to shopping centre and get lunch. Will defnetly be back.

NOTE:
-It is not fully operated;Royal Flush one of its thrilling rides was not opened until further notice, which is not anytime soon, it seems.

The deal; S$15 Entry fees only apply to off peak hours, that is, from 13:00 to 19:00 and during weekdays.

In my opinion, this water park is more suitable for teenagers than Advantage Cove.
_____________________________________
What I like about it:

-A lot of rides and short Q, and after 18:00 no Q.

-It's rain policy .For more details check it's web site

-Its easy to get to by MRT then shuttle bus or walk it from Pasir Ris MRT approximately 10-15 minutes.

-I no longer to have concerned not bringing enough coins for the lockers; it's lockers now takes credit card, debit card, and there are 3 sizes of lockers you could rent; grand.

-Little kids have their very own shower cubicles.

-Best of all, it is not a busy water park mainly use by locals.
______________________________________
What don't I like:

-certain part of its park shows signs of wear and tear.

-Water pressure in the women shower was seriously lacking ;you need to run around in the shower to get wet.

-It seems like nobody cleans the toilet Or shower throughout the day ; women's showers and toilets were very dirty ; tissues paper everywhere, hair everywhere totally disgusting. So, don't forget to bring a pair of slippers
Highly recommend for family with kids. Many attraction with water 💧 for smaller and bigger kids even for adults. It is whole days trip, food available and easy to reach by public transport.
It was good enough for me, my mum and 2 kids, my brother and his family of 5 plus his mum-in-law. A nice place to sit around when you don't want to play in the waters. Good security, clean.

REVIEW_TITLE: Awesome fun way to spend a short stop in Singapore with kids
REVIEW_BODY: We stayed at D'Resort Downtown East, which is just next door to the water park, it was super convenient and gives you discount for waterpark entry. Great way to spend in day in Singapore between 2 long haul flights (between Australia and Europe).

We went here for my daughters friends birthday. We booked a cabana for 6 adults which was about $100 extra on top of the entrance fees. We were given the 'Coca Cola' cabana. This was situated in a remote area of the park. To get to any slide you had to walk over blazing concrete. There are absolutely no covers over any walking areas. So don't wear anything other then flip flops. Otherwise you will have burnt feet. My son only wears joggers so he gave up after one slide. Sunscreen is a must also if you are a foreigner like us.
Our cabana rental came with 6 towels which were hotel white towels. Not thick nice beach towels. A choice of 6 drinks which consisted of no diet drinks even though the shop sold them. We chose 6 bottles of water. It also came with 'snacks' for 6 adults. We got one small box of chips and one small box of seafood. The seafood was about three deep fried soft shell crabs. One small piece of fish ( how do you divide that up between 6 people, 2 of which are vegetarians ? ) 3 small crumbed things that could have been chicken . I am really not sure. Just really awful. I was so upset I went outside and bought food back in even though they said no outside food. I certainly wouldn't go buy food from the snack bar if this was an example.
The slides themselves were fun.. But the water pressure wasn't much and most of us got stuck. Maybe it was the type of swimwear we had I don't know. But not enough to push us down most slides. The Tsunami wave pool was more like a ripple in a bath tub. And was turned off about every 15 minutes. The river 'rapids' were nothing and all you got was sun burn really...
I do like that there were plenty of life jackets for non swimmers and also life guards etc.
Over all it was a very expensive day for us and I probably wouldn't go again.

Park open ard 10-7pm daily.
Forgot hw much it cost for the entrance fee cos mine was free corporate card(pls check the park website).
We came ard 11am on Sat. Not much crowd. Changing rooms are clean. lockers are available cost S - $10, M - $12. Cash n nets accepted. Plenty of seating area. bcos theres only 3 of us we didnt rent the cabana which are available at min $98 peak period. Theres 1 cafe serves halal western food wf limited choice.i suggest u eat outside the park.theres plenty of choices to eat.McD,KFC,etc. No outside food allowed although they nvr check our bag. Dont forget ur sunblock.
Plenty of rides for kiddos to play. Waters clean. Overall kids had fun.we left at 6pm.
For Muslim-no moshollah available but outside the park there's prayer rm near MacD lvl 1.

With the new upgrade, there are a lot of rides suitable for both adults and children. My favourite is the Royal Flush. Recommended to come in groups! Also, surprisingly it's not that crowded on weekends.

REVIEW_TITLE: Do not visit if you have poor eyesight!
REVIEW_BODY: We have just abandoned a visit because of the strict no goggles policy. My 11 year old son cannot see without his glasses, so he has prescription goggles. He was not allowed on any slides but the duty manager suggested he could spend the day on the toddler activities. We had been looking forward to visiting the water park and asked for them to make an exception for him but they wouldn't. Their suggestion for people with poor eyesight was for someone else to lead them around the park. My son was brought to tears, which was upsetting for the whole family. We were given a refund for our entry fee only, despite the fact that we had also spent money getting there (and back) and it ruined the day for us. It should be plastered all over their advertising and website that you cannot visit if you need prescriptive eyewear.

Great place to bring children to enjoy the day . Weekdays less crowded. Be prepared to queue on weekends. The rides are not that scary though. Which is good for young kids . There are many new restaurants to check it out . Like the arcade and karaoke nearby.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fairly cheap afternoon out by Singapore standards
REVIEW_BODY: We went as two families, 3 adults and 4 kids aged between 9 and 14. Overall, everyone had a great time. There is a good selection of rides, my favourites were Torpedo, Freefall Slide Up and Royal Flush, all of which are probably the most adrenaline driven rides. There are some restrictions, 2 of the children didn't weigh enough to do Royal Flush, which did upset them a bit. There were hardly any queues, the maximum we had to wait was 15 mins for Ular-Lah, otherwise it was 3-4 mins per ride. Compared to a lot of activities in Singapore, it is relatively cheap and it keeps the kids occupied for an afternoon. The park is starting to look a bit tired around the edges with peeling paint and cracked concrete, but don't let this put you off.

The family and I went mid week. Which was more reasonably priced, but in all the waterpark is a joke. Especially if you have been to others and have high expectations or thrill seeking children.
A family of three as we were today could not ride anything together. As most rides are two seated or four. Someone always had to sit out.
The rides are weighted for small people. I weigh in at 120kg, (6’4) fit and toned, but was unable to ride some of the slides. This would not have been an issue if all the slides were open. As it was a week day, they alternate between opening of slides to minimise staffing. Which for a paying customer is irritating.
Hired the “bubbles” cabana. The netting was ripped, so we got bitten by some flying insects. Fridge was barely cold.
Overall, it’s cheap and nasty. So I should not have expected any better.

no queues for torpedo and free fall . They sound scary. I saw one young lady refusing to get into the torpedo capsule but the slides are short and not so scary . I did the free fall 3 times and the torpedo 2 times . I find the royal flush fun , especially if you face the flow and see where the tube is going . The heavier the people on the tube harder the flush will be . Slide up is scary if you slide off with your back against the flow as you cannot see where you are going and the slide down is steep
Ularlar is enjoyable and so is the yellow waterworks which is very relaxing . Younger children will love wild wild wet because there are many slides catering to them .

A good place to spend a day with kids. There are places for kids to play, now they have new slides for kids. If tired could just lie down at sunbeds or float around the lazy river. On busy days , it’s best to enter during opening time or you won’t have sun beds or at least benches to rest. This newly renovated is so much better.
Fun, a place you would return once or twice a year. There are not enough life vest for the children.
Comparing with the tourist packed adventure cove, rides here seems more exciting and service staff are friendly and helpful. Recommended

REVIEW_TITLE: Water rides in the sultry heat
REVIEW_BODY: Wild Wild wet is conveniently located in Downtown east Pasir Ris away from the hustle and bustle of the city,. The water rides are very interesting, some of them adventurous as well. Must visit for kids and adults of all ages
The park is fun and has many amenities. However, the cleanliness of the changing room puts me off. No cleaners in sight, and the toilet bowls were soiled in some cubicles.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice water theme park for all
REVIEW_BODY: Been there a few times and kids love it. Spend our whole day inside the theme park. There are so much kids can play there so adults can just sit back and relax in the water. Many rides for the older boys too but got to check with height limit before going up if not your little one might be ask to leave due to under height. Most of the rides during peak season might take up to 45mins so be prepare to wait for those very popular rides.

Very nive place but entrance is a bit pricy but they have a better didcount if you are NTUC member. My family loved most of the rides specially the 90degree free fall drop!. Maximum weight is 110kg so better start your diet if you exceeded to enjoy all the rides.
Great for all ages - including adults! Really fun rides and a lazy river to. Staff are ok as well. Highly reccomend.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great waterpark with lots for thrill seekers!
REVIEW_BODY: We are annual pass holders at Adventure cove waterpark and this was our first time to wild wild wet. The wave pool wasn't open and there were some other areas under construction but the kids loved the waterslides. It was not as nice as the one at Sentosa but if you have older kids looking for waterslides that are more thrilling this park would be the one to go to. The downside is the distance from the city but if you live out east its great. They do have a mall area with food just outside the gates which is great so you can have some good food and coffee while the kids slide

Fun day out with 10 & 15 year old. Enjoyed swimming & slides in the morning then when the storm came, went into centre to eat and waited for the storm to clear.

Safety is very strict, no goggles, glasses, watches, jewellery etc allowed at all. The lifeguards gave me tape to wrap my wedding ring.

Shop is close in case you need to buy swimming accessories, also place to hire towels.
Will highly recommend!

Family water park filled with water fun slides for the young children and teenagers e.g. drift pool, wave pool, children slides, exciting slides for teenagers and adults.food beverages stall are situated outside the park, it's so convenient to grab a bite when you are hungry.

REVIEW_TITLE: Its ok - getting a little tired now
REVIEW_BODY:
Visited with kids aged 14 and 12 recently.
Place is a little tired now.
It was a weekday so pretty quiet which was a bonus for the kids. no long queues.
Extremely warm, and IMO a lack of sufficient sheltered areas for people to sit around.
Kids seemed to like the rides but probably wouldn't be interested in returning.
Good value.
Limited range of food and drinks in the venue - and they didn't allow 'outside food'. that is a joke.
Amazing place cater to young and old. There is everything for everyone . You can spend entire day there

We went to both WWW and Adventure Cove- they’re very different but worth a visit.

WWW has more rides and variety- ranging from super fast and scary (Free Fall, Torpedo), moderate (Vortex,Ular Lah, Kraken ravers) to lots of slower rides for young children.

We went during off peak (4pm on a Thursday), basically no lines at all. Sadly the Tsunami wave pool was under renovation but there was also a discount on tickets (I think it was 2 for 1 deal- so only paid for adult)

The only disadvantages would probably be WWW is further out in the city but easily accessible by MRT (Pasir Ris) then one stop from the bus terminal. Also WWW is a bit older and more worn down compared to Adventure Cove. However no one checks your bags so can bring in your own food!

I would definitely recommend this waterpark rather than Sentosa. It’s cheaper and the slides are much more fun.
We went on a Tuesday around 11am so there were not many people in the park. We also got a cabana for half the weekend price which comes with towels, water, inflatable ring, faster WiFi, mini fridge and lockable cabinet, plus a locker if you want to use it but we didn’t bother, we just left our things in the cabana.
There are 2 super fast slides with vertical drops, one in a little chamber where he floor falls away, absolutely terrifying but so much fun. The lazy river is lovely and there is a big pool with wave machine. It gets quite deep towards to back, around 2m I believe. But the park has free life vests for all sizes, small children up to adults. Plus he big wave pool has lots of inflatable around to use. There is a snack bar as well where you can get fries and pizzas. You are supposed to get snacks with the cabana I believe but it wasn’t available when we went, maybe as it was a Tuesday. But we still went over to get snacks.
A fun day out!

There was a good variety of slides and rides to suit both my kids. The 7 year-old and 11 year-old preferred different parts of the park, but they both loved the Tsunami wave pool.

I found myself screaming with my daugther on the "Slide Up" ride. We plunged down a four-storey ramp, accelerating until I hit the deck and skimmed across to soar on the opposite side.

It was my 9 year old’s first time to the water park and she had a whale of a time! She found Ular-lah, Shiok River, Tsunami and some other long slide rides like Vortex really fun! There were a huge variety of fun rides to choose from and you can easily spend the whole day there without getting bored. There is a cafe near the changing room but you can go out to buy food too since there’s re-entry option. We queued up for a pretty long time to get the tickets, so I think going off-peak is a better choice. My Daughter has been asking to re-visit all the time and I hope I can convince myself to overcome the scorching hot weather and bring her there again.

REVIEW_TITLE: Newly done up and such a thrill
REVIEW_BODY:
We have always gone to Adventure Cove on Sentosa Island but as WWW was newly opened and much closer to where we were staying, we've decided to give it a go.

It was bigger and better than we thought. Everything was clean, spanking new and so looks very inviting. Good selection of slides and pools for younger children. Not too crowded- we went twice; once in a school holiday and once on a weekday and they were both fine.

Prices are a lot cheaper than adventure cove. Lazy river is prob not as good because it's shorter and doesn't go through sting ray pools like in adventure cove but all slides are better simply because there's less of a crowd so we did more of them! Food and drinks prices were v reasonable inside but you're allowed to leave and enter so can always go out to McDonald's nearby and bring it in.

It is located at the far East end of Singapore which might be difficult for some who are staying in the central areas to get to. Nearest MRT station is Pasir Ris.

Overall, definitely worth going.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun for all ages especially young families
REVIEW_BODY:
After much research I chose Wild Wild Wet over the Adventure Cove Water Park. Although a little trek out from our hotel in Pasir Ris the journey on the MRT was great and seeing another part of Singapore outside of downtown was wonderful. Just a short walk from the train station Pasir Ris was also a lovely place to walk through with lovely food stalls and Chinese cuisine.
Wild Wild wet was located conveniently to a mall where we had lunch before the park opened. Also stocked up on snacks and drinks for the day as took advantage of the Cabana package with loungers, fridge, safe, towels, water. Was perfect for our family of 5 with 3 children aged 6 and under. Loads for our 2 year old to enjoy with mini slides and splash parks. My kids loved it. We loved it and were in the water with them all the time. Wonderful memories had and best thing about WWW is that they didn’t try to rip you off on extras like photos and food. Really fabulous and value for money. Worth every penny today and stayed the entire time. Adults got to ride the scary rides but enjoyed the lazy river, wave pool and little slides with kids. Height restrictions spot on. 122cm and above for scary slides which is right. A couple where they can ride with an adult if over 1m. Plenty to enjoy otherwise as I mentioned we stayed the whole time 6 hours and kids cried when we left. Loved seeing another part of the city and glad we chose over adventure cove.

I went with my 3 yr old son and Wife. What i like about this water park, unlike others, they have 2 areas for kids. One near the entrances with 5 or so slides. Then inside one whole huge place complete with fountains, slides, climbing gyms and more.
Even for adults there are many great rides. The Vortex, Torpedo and Free Fall as usual is the best as for any park that has similar rides. Even Ular La was a nice family ride. All of us could sit inside the tube and come down twisting and turning. Fun with bumps along the way, but not dangerous for kids. My son luckily met the height mark.

Another plus point, is that unlike many other parks, you wont have to buy food from the inside places. They allow you to go out and buy. There is Mcdonalds and other cafe/fast food. So go out buy, bring in and enjoy.

Our first visit here and having been to adventure cove previously, this place was a lot quieter in comparison, with hardly any queue for the ride. We visited on a sunday and had numerous opportunity to go on all the rides which I did with my 13 year old son. Food was also great with a adjoining mall with plenty of halal options as well. Atmosphere was not as great as adventure cave and also there is a more variety of rides compared to wild west, furthermore its a bit of a distance away to travel by mrt. Will visit again.

We are not water play park people but with our 6 and 4 year old- it made for a very fun day under the hot Singapore sun.

The kids play areas are great (there is a younger toddler-friendly one nearer the entrance & an older kids bigger play area further in with at least 5 different slides)
Our young ones independently navigated their way around the latter play area effortlessly. Lots of the adults also loved the huge bucket of water that would tip and fall on the waiting people- pressure and impact is strong so kids under 6 need to be supervised or they will topple over or freak out)

We enjoyed the Lazy River and floats and life jackets are plentiful.

Tsunami was not very scary- just gentle waves in my opinion.

Food is a bit overpriced but you can always exit the park for other selections which you can bring into the park upon reentry.

Smaller lockers are SGD$10 a pop but you can reopen until you check out.

The shower cubicles are quite narrow but you dont have to queue because they are aplenty.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place but not much rides for toddlers or kids below 1.07m
REVIEW_BODY: Place is great for children/adults above 1.07m. A few daredevil rides for the adventurous ones but do note that most rides don’t allow glasses to be worn/jewellery.

Had two visits here as part of a holiday with family. The park kept all of us aged from 43 to 3 entertained. Plenty for both big and small kids to do. One of our trips was on a Monday and we got a great deal - $100 dollars for 7 of us including a cabana so worth asking if they have any deals going. Highly recommend.

First time into this place... it was consider quite big with lots of things to play with. Our children spend almost 4hours in this water park. They enjoyed almost everything. We bought the tickets at$22 per person (regardless of adult or child) at the D resort counter as we were guest of D resort. We went early in the morning on a weekday so there was not much crowd and we get to enjoy almost everything. Thou there’s some places restricted with height and weight control. Overall our family enjoyed our days very much and will definitely plan another trip there.
Ps: must be careful with your valuables, they do have lockers there and try not to put your bags or hand phones there unattended.

Wild Wild Wet reopens. With many more rides and a bigger space.

I had the opportunity to bring my 2 pre-teen boys during the June school holidays. It opens at around 10am during the school holidays (they call it the Peak period).

Bought their family combo - $92 (3 adults and 1 child below 13 years old). They usually have promo prices during school holidays - be sure to ask. If u are an NTUC card members, they have different prices for u too.

If u are not the swimmer-parents (like me & hubby), go to the office which is situated near the boarding gates and rent a tent (cavana). It costs u $80 (for whole day rent under NTUC card; normal peak price is $90). It can fit 4 persons. It has a fridge; 2 2-seater sofa, a lazy seat and a big float. U will be given 4 towels which u need to send back aft ur stay.

They also have a 6-persons tent which costs around $110 for peak period (NTUC card price).

Both offers comes with snacks like hot wings and fries (with can drinks), and u can request for the time to be served.

The kids enjoyed different pools; from baby pools, lazy river to ooo-la-la and jacuzzi.

Muslim patrons can go out of the Wild Wild Wet to do their prayers at E-hub musollas and re-enter the place again.

Family friendly, kids'friendly & Muslim friendly.

I'll be back. This time with my swimming burqa!

REVIEW_TITLE: Great day out at wild wild wet.
REVIEW_BODY: The floor was very slippery nice stuff insane rides. My favouirte ride was the red and yelow ride. we hired a locker it was very safe.

We are a family of 4 (including my girls aged 7 and 9).

My elder girl prefered those adventurous attraction but my younger girl will go for those kiddy attractions. It is great that the krazen racer allows kids with height above 110cm so my younger gal got to try it as she couldnt do it at legoland (the attraction with similar nature). But to qualify, the one at legoland is also higher. Hence i can understand the difference in height requirement.

As with other water park attractions, my husband and I face similar issues whereby our phone and spec cant be carried with us, so we will need to take turns to play.

1 attraction is quite interesting whereby it allows young kid to bring a float to swirl down (not sure what it is called) but my younger gal definitely love that since she cant play those more challenging attractions.

However, on the other side, I will like to feedback that the shoik! River and Tusunami (wave pool) flooring are all concrete and not sand. hence it is quite easy to get hurt. My hubby hurt himself quite badly when he was at Tsunnami.

Overall, we enjoyed ourselves and will recommend it.

Overall we enjoyed ourselves. Will recommend it.

The rides are really too similar from other amusement parks, a total waste of time, there is nothing unique of any of the rides, some of the colours does not look appealing to the eyes, Some other amusement parks are better than this one. You need to work on the design of your rides.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great fun and remember to bring sunscreen!
REVIEW_BODY: Can easily spend the day here, but the sun is so strong need to get hydrated and slap on some sunscreen. Easy to get sun stroke.

This is a relatively small water park compared to one in Florida or Dubai. It is an adjunct to a mall. Despite its size, it has some really good rides especially the Royal Flush! It is clean, well run and safe. The resort provides showers and lockers for hire - we spent four hours enjoying the tides and did the Royal Flush twelve times - that is a lot of stair climbing!

Chose this park over adventure cove- bAd decision! The staff are all miserable and rude . Didn’t see one of them smile . The rides are ok but not very good vibe at place compared to escape Malaysia or Legoland Malaysia - staff sooo much better . Stairs are solid which is good but overall I would say only go if you are looking for second place after adventure cove. Some of rides shut. Opens at one during the week.
We took our 1yr and 2yr old daughters and fun was had by all. Lots of slides for all ages. Went on a weekday and less busy Hours of entertainment!

We've been here a number of times - most recently this december and before that when we lived in Singapore 2010-2012. Our youngest kid is now 14 and he still enjoyed the afternoon in wild wild wet. The waiting times were not too bad, however, there is room for more effective customer service at the various water slides. sometimes the staff seems a little bored which makes it less fun. A bit more upbeat service would certainly help.

REVIEW_TITLE: a fun place for young and old
REVIEW_BODY: Have recently undergone a major facelift. More thrilling slides have been added on, and certain slides are deemed unsuitable for kids below certain heights. My 11 yr old boy tried the Vortex, and I was surprised that he enjoyed it. After all, it's a 4 storey slide and looked quite challenging. Probably due to the latest additions and the facelift, entrance is now a bit pricier especially on weekends. Clean place with many lifeguards on duty, safety seemed to be paramount. Have gone there many times before the facelift and will continue doing so, maybe not as often.

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent water park!! Fantastic water slides
REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic place full of water slides. It may not be as good as Adventure Cove in terms of variety of activates. The different water slides alone can keep the family occupied all day.

Went with my 8 y/o. On that day 3 of the rides were closed, limiting her to the kiddie slides, wave pool and the canal. She was bored in an hour. When the park has to close several slides, especially when it impacts a single age group, they should do the right thing and 1) post it on their website so the kids are not disappointed at the gate, 2) give a sizable discount since the park is not providing the full experience, 3) just close the park and do the maintenance or what you need to do. Other comments, the place isn't that clean and staff spoke english well enough to answer basic questions about the park. After visiting this place and then Sentosa, just go to Sentosa.

We stayed at D'Resort for 3D2N, complete with the 3-day pass for Wild Wild Wet. Our second time so we learnt from our first experience. Checked-in later to avoid the crowds, and it was a breeze. A lot more fun rides have opened since end 2016. The standard chalet rooms are okay, but nothing to shout about. If you want a more comfortable stay, I suggest you go for the rooms in the Rainforest Wing (where the hotel is, and access card is required to enter the lobby and its premises).

Other than that, WWW is a great and fun place for family to chill and spend time soaking.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great day out but room for improvement
REVIEW_BODY:
We stayed at the D’Resort at Downtown East for five days, which is integrated to the Wild Wild Wet waterpark, so of course we spent a day at the waterpark. Overall a great day out with the family but there are a few areas they could improve on;
- Very slippery surfaces, I almost slipped over if it wasn’t for the rail I grabbed on to nearby, and at the end of the day my 12 year old daughter slipped over and hurt herself - in both cases we were walking at normal pace, other waterparks I have been to don’t seem to have this problem, WWW management should see what other parks do to ensure the ground is not super slippery
- The main ride attraction, the Royal Flush, was closed right in the middle of peak season, other waterparks I have been to plan their maintenance so that all rides are open in peak season times
- the Shiok River could do with some more trees for shade and scenery to make it more interesting
- pretty pricey for the number of rides compared to other theme parks I have been to, although it seems they have a good balance on the price to ensure it is not over crowded, also while resort guests got a minor discount, it should be more

4 kids and 1 adult descended on Wild Wild Wet. We were definitely not disappointed. Great rides, clean spaces, ample facilities. Not crowded when we went which was a midweek and 10am schedule. What was a bit irritating was that one of the other rides was closed for maintenance but this was not on their website. Poor communication on the part of the park administration.

We organised our daughter’s 9th year birthday party at Wild Wild Wet with 11 other girls. We took the small tent / canopy which is very convenient. Plenty to do and the adults spent time chasing the kids... lot’s of fun and great value for money.

Well, if you’re prepared to waste your day, waiting between one or two hours for each chance to go down a slide and you’re happy to enter a swimming pool where most of the people are fully clothed, then go! On their credit, I’m happy to say they understood how much it ruined my precious family day in Singapore and they refunded me for the whole price.

I live very close to the attraction, so it is easier for me to get there, a few bus stop only from my house.
For tourist it is not quiet close. Suitable for those who live nearby Punggol, Tampines, Simey, Pasir Ris etc
Very affordable admission, big park with many great slides. Suitable for visitors all ages.
Not much food options available, better bring your own, or can buy outside. There are many restaurant choices just few meters away.
Spent there entire day, really enjoyed it a lot! On Sat were many visitors, still were able to find chairs for resting & keep our stuff.
Highly recommend for families with kids all ages, groups all ages.

REVIEW_TITLE: Should not even be listed as an attraction
REVIEW_BODY:
Have lived in Singapore for a while and where as WWW used to be the only option a few years ago I would say that now it is really not worth the effort.. the zoo or adventure cove are more fun. We came a few years ago and did not enjoy it then but one of our kids mentioned it had been renovated so we thought to give it a chance.... mistake!

Should have known from the initial queue that it wasn't any better managed, people busy trying to upgrade you to annual pass whilst only 2 team members processed the guests.. must say the 3 management looking on with crossed arms helped..

Inside the park there are several new slides but one was not open, others had no mats to be able to use (cage full of them but no way to get to them?!) long queues due to limited equipment and it generally seemed like no one was working or cared..

The whole ascetics of the place is bad, no planting or even upkeep of the park as the old elements where not even repainted

The attitude of the staff was shocking, some clearly did not understand English whilst others we just plain rude, similar to below with angry uncle scolding children for being excited.. to be honest it was embarrassing in front of friends to show them this sort of welcome at what is meant to be a fun park

We left shortly afterwards and we're happy to do so as you walked back through tables in front of the cafe overflowing with leftover food and plates being eaten by birds

Do not recommend

If the owners really want to see a class attraction they should visit waterbom in Bali

I went with my wife & kids on a warm and overcast Wednesday with a little rain.
The crowds were small and there was zero waiting time for the rides which were open.
The staff were very pleasant and helpful.
We kept our stuff on a bench / table with an umbrella. Later when the sun came out there was plenty of shade.
The kids, wife and i really enjoyed our day, we were there for 5 hours.
We found that the water park is in an area of continuing development.
The worst aspect of Wild Wild Wet is getting to the park from the bus as there is no stop close by. You have to walk from the main road through a building site.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worst recreation experience ever, mannerless people!
REVIEW_BODY:
We went on Saturday to celebrate my son birthday despite knowing that weekend price for ntuc member is the same rate as public and paying the same price for Sentosa Adventure cove! But the service we experience are so much worst, if you ever been to Sentosa, the staff will greet you with enthusiasm, welcoming all their visitors with open arms, especially you are in the recreation industry but what we experience in Wild Wild Wet are really depressing with mannerless staff! Especially I would like to highlight a lady staff at dark waterworks, water slide at 130pm on 16 September, this lady was very rude and arrogant, my kids are not aware that goggles are not allowed and run up the stairs eagerly to take the slide, the lady simply shout at my kids said "Goggles are not allowed!! you are not supposed to even bring it up!!" What's the point of shouting where the kids is just enthusiasm to take the ride? She could have talk in a mannerly way!

I never had such a disappointing experience in any recreation facility before with such dispassionate staff and not welcoming the visitors at all..

We had not gone here for a Long awhile as they were doing renovations. Our recent trip in August did not fail to surprise us. The new rides and different types of slides which cater to young children was definitely a much welcome addition to the place. I would say that it is complete for the whole family.

Went on a weekday, hoping for less crowds, but it was the school holidays.
Still it was a relaxed family experience, queues not so long with many other rides and slides to play without lining up. I think it is a well planned park with the renovations also making the entrance and new rides worth another visit.
Lockers are $6 though to store your stuff, a bit costly. $2 or $4 would be nice but nothing beats having your possessions still there when you come back. The locker attendant was nice and helpful when i made a mess with opening it up again. And also when i came back again to retrieve something i left behind after i left. I think the gentleman's name was David or something.
Overall had a nice day with my son and the only time he got upset was when we had to leave.

So much better than adventure cove, especially if you have smaller children. We went here and our daughter could just run and play on the smaller slides and in and out of the fountains to her hearts content.

Was disappointed that some of the big slides were closed, but the torpedo ride was great.

Would reccommend to to people with younger people.

If water theme park is part of your travel plan , recommend Wild Wild Wet . A value option to the Adv Cove @ Santosa. Much less people on weekday without the hazzel of queueing. We are satisified with the facilities and our kids @ 9 and 11 had a wonderful day enjoying a lot. Plenty of dining options outside the park which allowed you to have a quick bite and carried on the fun.

The water theme park boast a variety of rides, ranging from slides for the young and adults. There are also water playground for the young to run around. Nothing too adventurous to shout about for the rides but this is the only such water theme park in Singapore.

Spent the weekend in Wild Wild Wet. Complementary tickets for D'resort guests.
Nice park with many good rides. Not too crowded. The only negative is that the floor for some areas are pretty rough/worn out. If one falls, will suffer from abrasions.
Waiting time / Queuing for the rides are not that bad. Considering a weekend, I don't even need to queue longer than 10 mins per ride.
Will definitely return!

Much improved after a major renovation. Not all of the much needed new rides were open but the ones that are were popular. . Like Adventure Cove they need to visit Disneyland and Universal in Orlando to see how to get the maximum number of people through their rides safely. May be when all the rides are open it will live up to it's title of Wild, Wild Wet.

Those fun rides need at least 1.22m in height. Suitable place for all ages. My 6 years old gal got sun burnt for staying the whole day there and she has lots of fun. No outside food and they will check the bags. There is a small cafe within wild wild wet but quite expensive. Recommend to eat outside of wild wild wet with various fast food restaurants just a few steps away and you can re-enter with a stamp on your hand.

REVIEW_TITLE: Mild day but still good fun
REVIEW_BODY: Rides were good and not too scary for under 12s. Can't wait for the New rides to be completed for a faster experience. Went early at 11am and there were many lockers by the time we were leaving it was v crowded. Limited food in the park .
Fun water park with different levels of slides and thrills to cater to kids of different ages. Has a wave pool but beware of bees as a friend was stung by a bee there.. pretty hot without much cover.

I have not visited the place for the past 1 year and is pleasantly surprised by the change (and the extension).

My all time favourite is still the Ular-lah. It suits even the faint-hearted but is still exciting enough to make all wants to go for a second round.

A new ride which is Asia' first hybrid ride featuring both the Behemoth BOWL40 and TornadoWAVE (I have gotten this info from Wild Wild Wet website). It really made me scream my lungs out on my first try. I went another 2 more rounds after that. It is actually quite slow at first and then there is a steep drop and then a big twist (the scariest parts of the ride). It will be better if the initial part is slightly faster. Anyway, thumb up!

There is a limited time Woosh which is Singapore’s Longest Inflatable Freestyle Water Slide. It is only available in Jun and Jul 2017. Open during school holiday, public holiday and Fri to Sun. Hmm, nothing special about. It is just a long slide.

There is also a new Kidz Zone which looks interesting for children.

There were so many different pool and slide options that were available for my four year old. The river rapid was a hit, as were the junior slides. We spent the day going between the different pool options. It was never too busy as there is lots of space and so many things to do. We didn't get bored and if we had time, would have gone for another visit. We thought the lockers were easy to use and convenient as we needed to access them a couple of times during our visit. The only thing I would say is negative is their height chart is inaccurate. It starts about 10cm up the wall, so even though he did meet the 1 meter requirement, he didn't on their chart for the tube slide. Also, be careful to use hats and sunscreen as there is not a lot of shade.

The newly revamped #WildWildWet at Downtown East, Pasir Ris is now even more fun with the expanded premises and lots of new attractions. With Singapore's longest dual lane inflatable freestyle water slide at 50m, you can dive head down, on your butt or side or even on the Super fast mat to challenge your opponent to see who reaches the finishing line. There is also the new improved Kidz Zone where there are miniature versions of the more adult rides for kids below 8years old. The new "toilet bowl" attraction aka The Royal Flush promises to empty your lungs out with exhilarating fast speed down the huge tunnel. And finally there is the Free Fall, a dare-devil near vertical body drop at 55km/hr from a height of 6 storeys tall. There is currently a promotion till July 31st 2017 if two come dressed identical for a 50% off the entry fee. You can definitely spend a full day here as there are an array of other fun activities like the Orchid bowl and The eXplorerkids.

REVIEW_TITLE: Classy revamp, not so classy showers
REVIEW_BODY: Lots of attention paid to slides and attractions, but the smooth and sleek experience ends at the shower facilities, which is quite a necessary stop for most visitors except for those who stay at the resort attached.

The size of the place is just nice. Not small and not too big to explore. Water playground is fun but some slides are closed. Don't know why? No enough of floats and life jackets. Until almost closing time then able to find.
But the worst one is the locker's system. Some machines can pay by nets, but some machine cannot. Some machines can only pay for small lockers, not big lockers. I need a big locker to put our belonging for 4 paxs. No changes given. Even is NTUC member also pay under the rate of a non-member. If want to go back to the previous page, still need about 30 seconds to log out. I took my cash, nets and NTUC card about 10 times from my purse just to find a locker using the machine. I don't have the exact amount, so I want to use nets. But the nets is not working and need to wait to log out from the system again. Then use cash, paying non- member rate because no changes can be given. I almost spent 1/2 hour doing this locker system to put my belonging. Luckily I came with my husband and he brought my children to play first. If I am alone, sorting out how to use the machine for 1/2 hour, my children won't not have the patience to wait and will make me more frustrated figuring out the locker's system. Also the price is not cheap. Cost me $10 for 4 hours. Such expensive price for such a poor system.
We played until the closing time. The ladies washroom is full and queue is long. My girlfriend and I went back without shower. Only bath our children in the kids shower only.
The next time when I came here again will be staying in the chalet. So no locker and shower problem.

Places for birthday celebration is difficult to find as well as expensive in Singapore.
When talk about celebrities, we will looking forward for places allow sound pollution and space for joy.
Downtown East Chalets is a place I will say it met our needs. 3 days 2 night stay allow us to set up the place and we have a fun time in the Wild Wild Wet water park for a day of fun without cost for 4. This place situated in the east of the Singapore is affordable to many Singaporean and tourists as well as you can have the fun for the whole family. The water park is just next to the chalet and you can enjoy the 7-8 kinds of slides similar to most of the slides you have seen in most of the expensive water park in the world. Spending a day in this park was really worth the money (entrance fee is also affordable if no free entrance for guest of the chalet) and we had a nice BBQ birthday celebration in the night for our daughter birthday celebration. On the second night, we had another own family gathering by the corridor of the room and assure you the noise was definitely loud and will be asked to lower if this going to be in the hotel. However, over here noise is not an issue till late night. This is the right place for youngster, senior and even families who love fun and a day to enjoy together. The wet park got age limit, hence small children are restricted to certain slides which is common in most water theme parks in most places for your information..... Ok..... Have fun !!!

Half of your time or so you might be busy looking for life jacket for your kids coz so many are chope (privately reserved but not used).

Same goes to the tube. Kind of sick to that chope culture and mentality. The shortage has lessened the fun so so much.

Beside the above everything else is good.

Busy looking for life jacket and tubes so no time to take a single photo. Believe it.

Fantastic place for the entire family with attractions for the adventurous to the kiddos. I was also surprised that there were enough deck chairs/spaces for everybody.

Two gripes form me though that I hope the management will take note:
1) I fell down at the kiddo area because the tiles were slippery. I was actually quite shocked that it could be that slippery in an obviously wet attraction. Of course it seemed that the management knew about it with all the rubber mats placed around the kiddo play area. Yet these rubber mats proved to be tripping hazards too when it folded up. I tried looking for staff assistance to pull it flat, but unfortunately, none were in sight.

2) Having towel rentals near the tsunami is a bit of an illogical consequence especially when patrons generally do not carry money with them. At $10 deposit per towel is also ridiculous. I could have made money selling bath towels at half the price at the entrance to the attraction! Hope the management would consider making towel rental easier since it is obviously a need in such a place. To those visiting the place, BRING YOUR TOWELS!

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best water theme park
REVIEW_BODY: I went to the park yesterday. We had a wonderful time. It has many slides for family to take together. There is a river that let u flow and swims. There are slides for those who like challenges. There are huts that u can rent. Big floats for all ages to rent too. It was recently renovated and all the facilities are upgraded. So nice n new. Very good place for whole family.

Visited it yesterday with my 7 year old Daughter. It was a sunny day and was perfect for enjoying the water park. The water park is neat, slides are fun and overall the place is well maintained. The locker and changing rooms are very good. We found this way better than small water park at Sentosa island.

Important tip : please carry about 30-40 SGD cash with you as locker and float rentals only accept cash and no card.

We had a fun afternoon at Wild Wild Wet. There were plenty of water slides that my teenage daughters enjoyed. We visited on an off peak day (Tuesday) and there were basically no queques for anything. The facilities were modern and clean. The only reason I haven't given 5 stars is that 2 of the slides we really wanted to go on weren't open on the day we went.

The rides are awesome after undergoing revamp! There are plenty of rides suitable for little ones or free falling rides for the adventurous! There was never a dull moment!

The park is less crowded compared to "Adventure Cove" and value for money.

Definitely an attraction not to be missed. Prepare the sun block lotion or be baked!

REVIEW_TITLE: Ok but staff could be friendlier
REVIEW_BODY: Park is nice and well maintained, best to go during the week. Rides are ok and there's something for every age. Kids can use small slides and adults can enjoy some faster rides. Definitely better than the Sentosa waterpark! However, staff not really friendly and some height limitations are annoying for families.

REVIEW_TITLE: World-class water theme park right at our doorstep!
REVIEW_BODY: Can't believe this treasure island is just a 5min walk from our place! The moment we stepped inside WWW, it feels as if we are on a holiday somewhere! Love how they revamped the park & made it feel so open & spacious. We didn't get to try all the rides because our boys, aged 4 & 6, are still below 1.22m. Nonetheless, there's a lot of fun stuff for the kids to do! We went on the lazy river countless times & took the Ular-lah (tube ride down a winding slide) thrice! Everything here is in impeccable condition & the water is crystal clear! There are also ample seating (benches & lounge chairs), lockers & shower facilities. The only improvement I would suggest is to have more food options coz the only cafe there is serves mostly fried food. It would be nice to just have some hot soup & simple sandwiches... That being said, we are definitely coming back! In fact, we'd like to get the family annual pass once the kids are taller!

We went 2 years before reno. This time visited with Rainforest family room stay at d'resort.

I am glad they still keep the Jacuzzi because that was one of my favourite before the reno. The Shiok River is the best and I ride on and on countless times with my hubby and kids. The kids also go to the slides which got 6 or 7 slides of different difficulties. My gal enjoyed it most.

The place is smaller than Resort world adventure Cove but we can actually spend 5 hours, more than what we spend at adventure cove. Reason being its near the resort and we can wear our swimming costumes and walk very near to the special entrance for guests. So we didnt have to rent a locker and didn't bother to use the changing room. We just walk back to our room. Also E Avenue is connected to the WWW and so many food there. And can re-enter back to the WWW.

Its smaller but also less crowded. Great for kids and family. 5 stars given.

REVIEW_TITLE: fun park to spend the day with the children
REVIEW_BODY: This was a cool place to spend your weekend with your family. The location is quite far from downtown area, but it has everything that you need. Especially for moslem family like us, there's plenty of halal foods. And they also have surau (small prayer room), so if you want to stay from opening until closing hour, no need to worry about anything. My children have so much fun, they said it was the best day. And they tried 'almost' everything.

This was a great way to spend 2 hours getting away from the main hustle and bustle that is Singapore. I took my 13 year old nephew so I had to experience the thrill slides with him. First up the tube slide which was fun and a great precursor to the terrifying Torpedo which is without doubt one of the scariest things I have ever done in my 50years, a sheer drop of around 3 metres down a dark tube before levelling out through a series of twists and turns all in the dark and with absolutely no control over your body as it is engulfed in water wow. Yep,we went on it again and even though we knew the outcome it was still as frightening the second time around. We tried a few other slides which were tame in comparison to the Torpedo but still fun. We round out the visit with a slide in a inflatable raft down a rather steep ramp with a good white knuckle experience. I have marked Wild Wild Wet down one star as a couple of new thrill slide attractions are still in construction. I look forward to returning and sampling the new slides and providing that extra star. Highly recommend Wild Wild Wet

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun time with family and friends..!!
REVIEW_BODY:
We went to WWW on CNY weekend. Surprisingly it wasn't as crowded. Overall we spent good time with friends and family enjoying all the rides. There are lots of rides for kids and adults both. There is a good play area for the kids right at the entrance with lots of options ranging from body slides to fountains. Interestingly, WWW has lots of cabana's that can be booked(paid) either on the spot or in in advance on the same day depending on the availability. In addition to it, there are lots of free benches that can easily accomodate 4-6 people at a time.
Then the next section is lazy river. It was an average experiece there. It requires upkeeping and upgradation for sure.Found the walls were chipped and it wasn't an adventurous experience afterall. After that we went to the main body slides and water park section. Body slides were really good and exciting. Best ride of WWW is Torpedo where you witness a free fall for few seconds. I think torpedo by far is the most exciting part of WWW.
Overall, a good experience and can easily spend 4-5 hours depending on the queue and interest levels of the folks. There is another section still not open. It has lots of body slides and interesting water activities. We could only get a glimpse of it from the height but looked interesting and worth exploring once it opens.

REVIEW_TITLE: Still one of the best water park in the region
REVIEW_BODY: Adventure Cove at Sentosa offers more fun, but also at a very much higher price. Recently underwent a expansion, there is now areas better catered to the very young. The floors is no longer the sole destroying sharp surfaces it used to be. Queue management is good, you seldom need to wait for long before hopping on to your fun ride. Very limited food choices within, but can always get out of the premise to grab a bite, and re-enter without charge.

Decided on a water play on a hot day in December, since Wild Wild Wet reopens with new features we decided to head there. Awesome ! ny 6 year old son was trilled and had so much fun, in the we lasted there the whole day. No regrets with the new features. Kudos Wild Wild Wet !

Our family of four (children aged 7 and 10) spent a full Sunday at Wild Wild Wet and had a great time. Having been to water parks in Australia we were expecting to queue all day but the crowds never came. The park is relatively small, but is currently adding new rides. Despite this our children were fully occupied for the entire day. There's plenty of shaded seating for parents to sit and watch the kids. The park is integrated with Downtown East shopping centre and pass outs are allowed so you can pop out to the food court for lunch. There's also a small cafe onsite if you prefer to stay in the park for lunch.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth a visit, but half of it was closed!
REVIEW_BODY:
Pretty good value for money. We went on a Sunday expecting there to be thousands but actually not busy at all and we had great weather
Bring your own food as the local stuff inside is terrible. All unhealthy options and fried, crisps and fizzy drinks
The restaurants in the mall are poor too.
There are two torpedo slides which are fast and an inflatable half pipe for the thrills. Loads of tubes for kids up to 12....unfortunately two major sections were closed so just had to keep going on the torpedo over and over
Lockers are free and there are lots of sun beds under sails and umbrellas
Wave pool is good too
Again great for younger kids

Visited this theme park after I saw in the newspaper that the renovation was almost completed. It was definitely worth the visit as compared to RWS, especially if you have children less than 12 yrs as they would not be able to take the rides that are too thrilling. Our favourite ride is Ular-lah, going down as a family down the slides was so enjoyable! The only thing that need improvement would be the shower facilities, if hot water can be installed, that would she great!!

REVIEW_TITLE: Plan one hour queue to enter and very expensive
REVIEW_BODY: We arrives at around 2:15pm a thursday during christmas holidays. Only one desk open so very long queue. I ask one staff about it but told us he was only security staff. After 30 minutes, the staff finally got the idea to open new desks and it went faster. Really a pity to wait so long, with kids being impatient. Better go to Marina bay sand water games, free and no queue!

REVIEW_TITLE: Good though some rides are closed
REVIEW_BODY:
Visited as a family of four, including two young children. Our admission to Wild Wild Wet was bundled with a D'Resort stay next door, and there are substantial savings to be had with the bundled package if you are visiting the water park daily during a stayacation.

Our comments:

The park’s operating hours during school holidays is 10:00AM to 7PM, and we got to the park 10 minutes after opening hour. Check-in was easy as we already had our tickets, and even if not, and there were also no queues to speak of.

We stayed for about 2 hours, and possibly because it was a weekday albeit also a school holiday, the park didn’t feel crowded. There were plenty of crew on station to keep an eye on things.

The Shiok River was fairly gentle and safe for three year olds in tubes. And if that wasn’t reassuring enough, every 15-20 meters or so stood a park crew equipped with life buoys. The Professor’s Playground is designed for kids, but the large water bucket that was filled and emptied every couple minutes was a big hit for everyone – especially adults.

In all, the park is great, though that some rides were closed was a downer.
Place is beautiful. Well done. But not allowing people to swim with a little bit of drizzle? Quite ridiculous.

REVIEW_TITLE: All the fun and excitement for the whole family in one place!
REVIEW_BODY:
This place is packed with fun filled water activities for all ages. It is also one the first water themed park in Singapore that uses a prepaid cashcard payment (throughout the theme park for payment for drinks, food and etc.) that can be strapped onto your wrist so that you do not need to bother about taking too much cash or where to hold them.

Your kids can fully enjoy their fun without you getting worried for them when they are thirsty or hungry.

Good family fun can also be found in all the water rides!

To get there is also easy as parking is plentiful and easily accessible by public mode of transportation.

By Public Bus - At Pasir Ris Bus Interchange, take bus services 3, 5, 6, 12, 17, 21, 89, 354, 358 and alight at the first bus stop leaving from Pasir Ris Interchange.

By MRT - Alight at Pasir Ris MRT Station, EW1. You can reach Wild Wild Wet by taking the bus services from Pasir Ris Bus Interchange or by foot.

By Taxi - Inform the taxi driver to drop you at Wild Wild Wet or to 1 Pasir Ris Close, Singapore 519 599.

By Car - If you are traveling from Pasir Ris Drive 8, you will turn right into Pasir Ris Drive 1. Cruise along Pasir Ris Drive 1 and turn left to Pasir Ris Drive 6. Travel along Pasir Ris Drive 6 and you will reach Downtown East.

If you are traveling from Loyang Ave, you will be connected to Pasir Ris Drive 3. Travel along Pasir Ris Drive 3 and you will reach Downtown East. Traffic along Pasir Ris Drive 3 can be heavy at times.

If you are traveling from Elias Road, you will be connected to Pasir Ris Drive 3. Travel along Pasir Ris Drive 3 and you will reach Downtown East. Traffic along Pasir Ris Drive 3 can be heavy at times.

Went last week with my kids and Friend and their kid. There is renovation going on and usual taxi drop off point is closed. Now the place gets little boring with new play area for kids is a big disappointment. The Tsunami pool had waves once every 20-25 minutes or so.
Rest attractions are as usual and safe for kids, well managed.

Was there today 10/10/2016. This attraction is going through refurbishment; doubling in size but it is not completed; it would be completed end of this year. However, there were still sufficient rides for my 10 years old and me to hang there till 18:00.

What we like about this attraction:
- If you have forgotten about bring a towel you could rent it for $4 for the public and $3 for D' Resort guests.
-Entrance fees were inexpensive for D'resort guests: $13 for adults and $10 for my son.But for some reason; i was charge $20 in all only...hmmm..no idea why

-Its lockers would take old and new $1 coins only

-There are large and small lockers

-My locker wasn't working ones i put the coins in but it was ok help was just a buzz away; fabulous!

-plenty of eatery immediately outside this attraction , such as, Subway.

- Practically no Q; absolutely fabulous!

-Toilets and showers are clean.By the way, if you don't want one of those push handle shower use the showers at the back where you get a pull handle shower; much better. you would understand what i meant when you use the shower :-)

-There were loungers and they were newish and clean

-There were coin operated drinks dispenser dotted all over this attraction

- You could bring your own food in; have a picnic ; no problem.

- Like their Rain Code policy. Should it rain over 30 minutes resulting you unable to use this attraction your tickets would be stamped ; you would be allow to use your tickets again to enter the attraction again within 60 days .

- We were delighted we did not have to carry the tubes for the Ular Lah; thumbs up!

- Camera is allowed ; thumb up!

-No selfie sticks! thumb up!

What we didn't like:

-the locker, ones you close it to open and close it again it would cost you another $3; that IS an inconvenience not to mention costly

-If you need to change your notes into coins; its coin dispenser only takes $2 notes.

Do take a note:

-This attraction only opens 13:00 to 19:00 during weekdays and 10:00 to 19:00 during weekends

- It has added 6 new rides to its exiting rides but these are NOT up and running at the moment until end of 2016

Looking forward to visit this place again next year!

We went on a Monday , so it was only open in the afternoon. Very tame water slides , at one point on both slides I stopped moving and had to wait for the water to build up to get moving again , Kept the kids occupied for a few hours . Will be nice when the rest of the park opens .
Limited food , hard to get taxis.

Currently some expansion work is going on but still does not spoil the fun. We went on Monday
Good for young children and families to enjoy water based activities.
Kids waterplace is good with plenty of space and even if gets crowded its not uncomfortable.
River is good, you may float freely but at one point there is some kind of small opening where they force water at tremendour pressue like Jacuzzi , be careful as it hurt my foot while walking there.

Not much food or beverage options but there are some outside park though limited.
Overall a decent place.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great way to de energise children!
REVIEW_BODY: Went mid week so not too busy. Kids (4 and 2) didnt want to leave (wave pool, kids slides, ooh la la) plus plenty of higher rush slides for older kids / adults if needed. Needs more food / drink options.

Far out of the city centre in downtown east. It's a water park in a housing estate area. The pools and rides are fun and you need to watch your kids. Fun enough but really hard to get a taxi back into town.
There are great slides and pool for people of all ages. The slides are fun . There is also a jazuzi pool for relaxation. Everyone has a place to have fun. We really enjoy ourselves.

This water park results quite small and entertainment resulted limited for adults & adolescents. Preferred (and only) attractions were definitely the Torpedo and the U-shaped one - high thrill guaranteed.
I find it a bit over-pricing - paying same price for adults and kids over 12 is exaggerated.
Last but not least, some staff are really aggressive - safety is a must of course, but we are here to have fun and they are not police ! At 50 years old, I don't want to be yell at just to stand at the right waiting spot
Really looking forward to the extension opening !

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun with water under the sun
REVIEW_BODY: This place is so much fun! There's a lot of rides to try from, from the relaxing and literally go with the flow Shiok River to the heart pumping Torpedo (though I wasn't able to try because I cannot handle the fast and hard pump of my heart just looking at the other brave ones try!). We came with a kid and he really enjoyed the water especially the Yippie! and Professor's Playground. We tried the Ular-Lah and Water Works and were so fun and exhilarating! I like the adrenaline rush that the Slide Up had on me. Its a different feeling you will have unlike Torpedo where its all dark, Slide Up is exposed and your first slide is a rush and then subsides as your momentum subsides. Great place and a lot of enjoyment.

It was quiet considering it is the school holidays now. We were about 4th in line for each ride we took. Paid $4.50 for six-piece chicken nuggets which is reasonable. The construction is still ongoing and there isn't any new rides. The walk path to Jacuzzi is too narrow - like a person's width only and I wonder how they passed the FSB approval. Overall it was relaxing and fun day for us.

REVIEW_TITLE: Simple fun for the young ones...
REVIEW_BODY:
Brought my 10yo daughter there on a Friday afternoon.

There were very few visitors and it is perfect for us. We took the rides as many times as we like without having to queue for more than 5 minutes.

The "Torpedo" through which you will experience free fall from 4-storey high is pretty interesting. Another interesting one is the "slide up". The other rides are very common but my daughter still has a lot of fun! She later befriended another young girl and they went off playing by themselves.

Note:
1 Bring slippers as it is difficult to walk on the pebbled-walk way
2 Do not bring unnecessary valuables as the locker is pay per use.
3 There is not much food available for purchase inside the water park, but it is just next to "Downtown East" mall. You are allowed to leave the park for your meal and enter again but ensure you get a stamp on your hand before leaving.
4 If you are driving, park at the multi-storey carpark of "Downtown East" at walk for 2 minutes to the park.

I definitely loved the way on how they made the recent opened ride... I am not sure what it is called but it is the one which has the extreme feeling at the start in a cubicle and then you fall onto the slide and you go all the way down.. For me when I first went there,I was scared since it was my first time but after going a few rounds I felt used to it...
I would recommend this to anyone who loves EXTREME water park rides

This is a typical waterpark with the usual rides. No real surprises but it delivers what it is supposed to - a fun day under the sun. What impressed me the most was that the whole place is so clean and well-maintained - from the crystal clear water to the spotless shower rooms.

We were there from 10am to 2pm on a Sunday, and there were no long queues for the rides. In fact, my 2 teenage boys managed to go for the Ular-la ride a grand total of 7 times! I attribute the lack of queues to a good pricing mechanism. At around S$20 per person (after some merchant discount - normal price S$24 for weekends), it is not exactly cheap, but if it were priced any cheaper, the crowd may come in and spoil the enjoyment. So I would say that it is priced just right. Though the park does have some water features and playground for the very young, I would say that the majority of the waterpark-goers are teenage groups.

Do bring lots of sunblock. I underestimated the severity of the noon sun and was still suffering from the worst sunburn ever even after one week.

Two of the rides, Torpedo and Slide up are wild but the rest are pretty average. Ulah- lah is fun and gentle. The Water works slides need more slope or water as both my wife and I ground to a halt mid slide a good few times before getting to the bottom. I'm less than 80 kg and she much less than 50. Maybe the age of the slides and deteriorating gel coat have resulted on less slippery surfaced. Lazy river nice and gentle. Don't be fooled by the pictures of exciting rides - they have not been built yet! We came18 months ago and still nothing has been added. If this is in the top 10 Asia water parks, as claimed, there can only be ten in Asia and this must be firmly at the bottom. Head for that funny little island to the south if you want a better experience.

From Google Maps I found that this waterpark is close to Changi Airport. We went there instead of waiting five hours for our flight and it was just perfect. Great slides, waves, fun for kids and young adults.

Small water park with limited rides.So disappointed .
Finished less than 2 hours .
Not as crowded as I expected on a public holiday .
Tsunami was a mini one and I regard it as a "dangerous zone "since a lot of people even myself got cut on a sharp,rough stone floor inside the pool.Through my observation,either on the elbow ,knee,upper arm and toe/feet.
The whole area ground/floor made of rough stone and lots of small small stone lying on the floor so it's hard to walk barefoot while doing all the rides .
