No outside food and drinks but a lot of them brought home food cooked and nothing to eat inside the park except small stall selling hot and cold drinks ,hotdog,nuggets and cheese fries which were quite pricey .No idea whether it can be eaten by all walks of life since I overhead one customer asked the seller about how the food is bring prepared,unfortunately she never answered and no sign on the stall for confirmation or clarification either so it was quite confusing for certain people .
There is a vending machine but pricey too.
I suggest before you decided to keep your stuff inside the lockers please double check since you need to pay again ,in case you would like to buy any food and drinks later .
The toilet/shower pretty small and limited cubicles as You need to queue for a while .
Please dress accordingly as some staff that managed the station rides may stop you if you did not wear accordingly for example bathing suits that has zip at the back since according to them ,it might damaged the slides.
Since the rides are very limited....You might waste your time there because of your attire.
Not much bikinis or Swimming costume seen as most of the ladies,women worn a conservative bathing suits even the men.
They were some constructions happening ,hoping more better rides or more rides to spend our day with our loved ones .
Complimentary life jackets and rubber rings provided.

Very few attractions and not much to do for toddlers. There are renovation going on right now, hopefully the future additions will be worth it. At the moment won't be coming back till the park complete its revamp
I have an annual pass to this place cause I really love coming here for a few hours every few months, with friends or family!! Recommended for families

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun and relaxing! But WARNING HOT FLOOR
REVIEW_BODY:
We went there on the weekend of CNY / Saturday late morning and were surprised to find little crowds! That made the vibe very relaxed and fun with minimal queuing for rides. Our fave was the royal flush and the vortex rides! I think those are the new rides. A couple of the staff at the rides were super fun but most looked pretty bored. First time I was there since 2004 and wow the place looked great. Big clean toilets are a plus.

The cons is the price- we went in under a free pass but I can’t imagine paying $24 for what was offered in the park. Also the flooring was super hot due to the sun esp the royal flush area your feet will BURN. Suggest that more shade is provided in the large open spaces between the rides and add mats on outdoor shower floor or add more places to deposit shoes. Locker prices were also ridic, but people seemed to just leave their stuff on tables and chairs- I guess sg is safe. But overall a great fun and relaxing time! Recommended esp during off peak times!

REVIEW_TITLE: Much fun, but only one truly wild ride :)
REVIEW_BODY: A well-managed water park with rides for all ages. Kids would definitely love it. A couple of wild rides but there is one 'torpedo-type' where you're thrown down a pitch black tube after a sinister laugh that was quite awesome. The wave pool and lazy river were a bit small as they quickly became really crowded.
went along with my lovely friend, was quite an enjoyable day, enjoyed all the rides and attractions, good area to cover and enjoy and chose it over other parks.

An amazing place to spend your weekends with Friends, loved ones and family.

The place always lifts me up.

Rides are amazing and have improved since I was last there back in 2011.

The locker system has changed, looks good but didn’t return my 2 Sgd :)

Definitely should not be missed if you are in Singapore.

the staff there was very helpful and we rented a cabana for the day. One of their staff by the name of Jumali, was very kind and was very helpful along with the staff there. Mr Jumali was also kind enough to allow us to use his NTUC member card to get a percentage off from the total price of the cabana. Mr Jumali and his team's hospitality was great. I would really look forward to going there again. Thank you guys for making our day great

came here on Thursday to my surpirise 3 rides were closed and thye did not even notify us via the wesite or even let us know when making ticket purchase, waste of out time. I have been coming here since 2006 and will never come here again, lifegguards are rude when asking for directions, Waste of money
Waterpark rides are suitable for all ages. Thrilling yet cute rides are available. Good for family to couples. Great hang out spot for water beach lovers.

REVIEW_TITLE: Better when the new slides open
REVIEW_BODY:
This place is ok. Considering that there is a public waterpark that is very inexpensive (Jurong East Swimming Complex), Wild Wild Wet waterpark is better but not worth the extra cost. The public waterpark will cost you about S$5 for your entry, tube, and locker. This place will cost you about S$25 for entry, tube, locker.

The slides at this place were good. There is stuff available for all ages. As an adult, I found the most advanced slides to be scary. The torpedo is the kind where you're in a chamber and the floor falls out beneath you. It's smooth but you still will get a scrape or a knick. I did it twice and was very nervous both times. Just hold your breath and close your eyes the whole time until you notice you're done. Such a weird feeling.

The other slides are fun. We only did slides and one lap around the lazy river. It took us 2 hours. Lockers are $3 in coins and there is a coin machine it appears. Tubes are free. I'm not a slide enthusiast but these are the smoothest slides I've been on. The seams rarely hit your back. The lazy river is boring and not fun. I really liked the lazy river at Jurong East Swimming Complex. The current is faster and more water sprays.

We went Saturday afternoon at 12:30pm. It wasn't crowded. By the time we left at 3pm, it had longer lines but it was just fine. I bet Sundays are the busiest days though.

If money isn't an issue, this is a fun time for a couple hours. If money is an issue, go to Jurong East Swimming Complex. It's almost as good and entry is like S$2.

Once the new slides open, this will be a fun park and worth the money. It looks like there are about 6 more large slides opening soon and we were told about December 2016.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun filled day in the east of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
Although Im a local but it was my first time visit on 13 Aug 2016. If compare with Sentosa's Adventure Cove, this is of much smaller scale but with its own uniqueness. It's still work in progress - you can see some construction going on.

Overall is fun and relaxing, the rides are not scary. Great place for children and fun seekers. When you walk bare footed in the park, becareful of small lose stones like pinching your feet. It's like stepping on small lego bits.

The toilets and showering facilities can easily crowded near to closing time(7pm). So make your way to the toilet early and there is 2 locations for the toilets. One is the main and the other is made up of shipping containers right at the big pool with the waves.

Food-wise, not much in the park but plenty just at the entrance of the park - the Downtown East shopping mall. You can have fast foods but there used to have a food court near Subway but that entire area was cordoned off for upgrading works.

Overall fun and recommeded for short and simple day out.

this place is just crap, its overpriced. no promotions or crap. its just a piece of crap. tada dont go there.- singaporean review - trust me its crap the water is so damn dirty, the people there arent nice. oh god i cant even

Upon arriving i had to queue for around 25 minutes to pay $24 per person on Sunday. Inside you have to walk about 10 minutes to reach lockers, it is simply impossible to rent a towel as there is no 1 at the counter. The only F&B outlet looks very dirty.
As for the rides - very average, the whole park seems to be too old.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great stop off waiting for evening flight
REVIEW_BODY:
Had a 12:30am flight, so on our final day we stopped off here for a few hours to relax before our flight.
The place had a couple of good water slides and wave pools. Entry was only about $20 pp. Just bring cash for lockers, food and towel hire.
the only water themed park in singapore thus it is very crowded especially on weekends. there are however cheaper alternatives like the jurong east swimming complex and the sengkang swimming complex.

The water park itself was very clean and looked brand new.
The rides were very ok and semi thrilling. I will say the rides are probably not meant for a +200lbs 6ft American.
The Freefall water slide was probably the only slide i didn’t feel like I was getting slammed on, also for a “drop” slide it was very smooth.

The real downer for my was the no watches on the rides, you can’t even have them in your pocket or hold them on the ride.

REVIEW_TITLE: Not allowed to bring camera's anymore
REVIEW_BODY: I paid 30$ taxi, then around $60 for everything to go inside. I had a go pro strapped on my head and wanted to make videos and they told be video is not allowed, even though online there is many people making videos about the slides. Will never return. Staff were rude, do not waste your time here

This would be a good park for families with kids under 10. Several waterslides to choose from -none of which are particularly thrilling. There's nothing 'wrong' with that as long as you know what kind of park you're gong to. If you're hoping for adrenaline rushes, you're not going to find it here. However, if you're looking for a park to take the family where you can relax with a book and let the kids run around, then this is probably a good pick.
Extra fees to know about: lockers are $8-10 (depending on size), towels are $4 (with a $10 deposit)

REVIEW_TITLE: Great way to fill in an afternoon
REVIEW_BODY: Pretty good water park, with a variety of rides from the pedestrian to the more exciting. Would check ahead to see if any of the rides are closed before heading out however as several weren't in action when I attended. All up great fun though - would definitely recommend for families
The stations overall are okay. There are instructors in each station to ensure the safety of guests. The cleanliness of the theme park is also very well maintained.
Brought my toddler here and we had lots of fun. It will be perfect if there’s a cashless system for food or item purchases inside (eg. like Bali Waterbom barcode wristband)
Had fun with a group of friends and my family! Nephew enjoy the torpedo so much! Prices are average and it’s free with staying at D’Resort.

I have been going to this place every year and when i heard it was under renovation i was excited to see the new installments! However, it was disappointing as the slides are more towards a younger crowd. The slides are not as fast, although they do have the torpedo drop which was fun!

REVIEW_TITLE: Water park for all ages ... and all levels of bravery
REVIEW_BODY:
Pros:
- Nearest MRT is Pasir Ris station that takes about 10-15 minutes by walking, but there are nearby bus stops leading to the station
- Attractions cater to all ages … and all levels of bravery
- Rental for locker is good for the whole day
- Though outside food is not allowed, there are food stores inside. Another option is to have a meal at the adjacent malls where there are fast food chains, restaurants and food courts.
- Clean bathroom and changing rooms
- For those staying at D’Resort, there’s an exclusive nearby gate
- A lot of improvements and new attractions since our visit 2 years ago

Cons:
- Can’t say any cons as the adults and kids enjoyed our visit

REVIEW_TITLE: A good place for family outings
REVIEW_BODY: A place that is great to bring your kids here for slides and fun. There's also lots of restaurants and other activities to choose from within the compound

REVIEW_TITLE: A value for money experience, when discounts are offered.
REVIEW_BODY:
I visited the Wild Wild Wet water park on 04/10/2017.
It is a park with myriad of rides/slides for visitors of all ages.
There is a minimum of about 1.2 metres for most of the slides, due to safety concerns.
Families with very young children should take note about the minimum height requirements.

Goggles and watches are not allowed at the slides rides, due to safety consideration of the visitors.

Visitors who wish to try all the rides (slides) need to take note that they have to climb stairs of about 3 to 4 storeys high for most of the rides and some may require you to carry the styrofoam slides (eg: Krakan Racers) or inflated boat up the stairs.

I will advise those elderly visitors with mobility or cardiac issues to refrain from attempting the slides if you have difficulty climbing stairs/experience breathlessness.

There is also locker rental fees of $8.00 per time (unlimited opening and reopening of the same locker till the park closes), which I felt was a bit too expensive.
But it will be necessary if you are visiting the park alone with nobody to assist you with watching of your personal properties.

As of October 2017, only the "Royal Flush" ride was not in service due to safety checks and maintenance required.

Worth a visit, if you just want to experience a waterpark with fun slides.
Cheers!

Went with a group of friends. Had a lot of fun!!! There was quite a number of rides, and most of them had very short queues. Good for about half a day of fun. The Torpedo ride was extremely thrilling!! WOO! The "seeing double" promotion was extreme value-for-money. In my opinion, much more fun and worth it than Adventure Cove. Recommended to go with an even number group, though not necessary. One word of caution though, Slide Up is not good for people with back injuries!! I may have injured my back while riding Slide Up as it has an extremely heavy landing, but even that couldn't dampen my mood. An extremely enjoyable experience!

Visited on an off-peak Friday, so while there were more people than usual compared to other weekdays, the waiting time for popular rides was not very long. Having visited several times as a kid last time, I am happy to see new rides being added after the revamp. Tried out Royal Flush, Free Fall and Torpedo this time, and it was certainly an exhilarating experience! Will definitely be back again in future to try out the Vortex and Kraken Racer when they are open. My only grouse was that The Waterworks wasn't open throughout the day, they alternated operations of the two slides before closing it later on. Hopefully both will continue to be open as I didn't get to try one slide during this visit. Overall, the water park caters to all ages, with family-friendly rides and also rides that cater to adrenaline-seekers.
Visited the park while holidays with a group of friends!! Awesome place to have fun and chill, the slides are also very thrilling !! Overrall an very awesome experience !

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun park for family with kids!
REVIEW_BODY:
Went to Wild Wild Wet on Saturday, Christmas long weekend. I was expecting huge crowd but was pleasantly surprised that it was not as bad.

Entrance to the park has changed from our last time. We took locker. It is 10 dollar from small and if holding annual pass, 9 dollar.

We started with Kids slides and then Slide up! Slide up was thrill, it is like a free fall, seating in double tube, from a height forming a U. Feels as if you will go all the way and fall from other side. Good slide!

Then we jumped into lazy river. Moved to Kids area. Then we did bigger slides. Torpedo was among the most thrilling. It took time to make my mind. 5.4..3..2..1.. the time inside the chamber builds up the fun.

We took break for snacking. We were 14 people including kids and headed to wave pool. We spent almost 40 mins and thoroughly enjoyed it. It is not big but whatever it is, is enjoyable with family and friends.

It rained heavily towards the evening and the park was closed, we were done by then but check the weather when you are going there to avoid disappointment.

Showers and changing area was clean and big enough. Overall we enjoyed, had a good time. Just one suggestion which we felt that, park can have one more wash-room area. Currently it is near locker room and with kids, you may have to walk a lot many times.

Recommended for locals. For tourists, it is not a very big park. If you love water parks and have sufficient time, you can plan for a half day; not a much though.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun place but do be careful
REVIEW_BODY:
Fun day out if nothing goes wrong. There are only a few rides but you can do them as many times as you wish. If you have never been to a water park or are not a good swimmer, be sure you know what to do to stay out of trouble. The staff there aren't really paying attention and life guards not that alert. I almost drowned in a shallow pool at the end of a slide because I was pushed under by the gushing water each time I tried to surface. Since I had no idea that it was a shallow pool, I tried to swim instead of stand up. Plus my small size did not help. Had I known, it might have been a less terrifying situation. It doesn't take long to drown if you have no idea what to expect and what to do in a situation and no time to react properly. It would have been different had I been told what to do. But the staff at the start didn't tell me anything even though I told him it was my first time, and the life guard at the end didn't respond.

There is also a tsumani pool which is fun but you can graze your foot badly in that pool. I think alot of people have hurt themselves in here. Do not try to swim until you are well clear of the shallow end because the wave will push you back and you won't realise how far back you have gone, so when you kick your legs next, it will hit the floor as it happened with me. Other than that, it is okay for experienced swimmers and water park goers. For the less adventurous, I suggest going in the river, the jacuzzi, and the Ular-Lar slide.

Only 4 rides were open when we went - 2 flume slides (one open, and one covered), Slide Up and Ular-Lah. We also went in the tsumani pool, jacuzzi and the river. You may want to bring your own towel ($4 to rent plus deposit), water and snacks. It costs $3 for a locker. Each time you open the locker though, you will need another $3 to lock it up so take what you need out before you lock it.

There are too many people on weekend afternoons, so you might want to get there when it just opens or go on a weekday.
